results.title: Grampians wonderland
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description:
The Grampians mountain ranges rising from the plains of western Victoria were discovered by Major Mitchell and continue to delight tourists. This program shows the exquisite wildflowers, the animal life, the rugged mountain scenery and the foaming waterfalls which make the Grampians so beautiful and so popular. Winner of an AFI Award: 1959.

The convertable car used in this film is a Triumph TR3A.

results.title: All the love
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Spastic Society of Victoria in the care and treatment of the cerebral palsied. Activities are designed to suit individual cases, always with the aim of fitting them for a normal life. Shows a variety of therapeutic treatments, and the organization of workshops within the Centres and under contract to outside companies.

results.title: 16mm news camera with Cosmicar zoom lens used by GTV-9
results.brief_description: Model 0. Manufactured by Mitchell Camera Corporation Glendale, California. Complete with added Cosmicar zoom lens 22.5-90mm and wooden tripod. Used by GTV 9.

constellations_primary.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_primary.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

results.title_for_label: 16mm news camera with Cosmicar zoom lens used by GTV-9
results.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field. Three-legged tripods made from firm materials like steel and wood helped steady the kind of image that was collected in production vans for Cinesound Productions and Movietone News. Designed and manufactured in Los Angeles, this model was an improved design on the earlier Mitchell cameras, which were widely used by film production companies like those at Pagewood Studios in Sydney, Australia. The Mitchell Newsreel Camera was a quieter alternative, making it less invasive on sets and in the field.
description_for_label: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field. results.title: Just desserts
results.brief_description: This wonderfully sensuous short presents the rites of puberty as a menu of Italian favourites: a young girls first period occurs when she is stomping the grapes; gnocchi is forever to remind her of first having sex with a boy; burnt polenta is the taste of lesbian longing. A lovely remembrance of an Italo-Australian adolescence.

results.title: At sea
results.brief_description: A baby boy dies on the journey from Los Angeles to Australia and is buried at sea. Many years later his mother still grieves for him, painfully and bitterly. Penny Fowler Smith uses highly evocative and sometimes abstract imagery to visual the mother’s emotional narration. At Sea is a cinematic reflection on loss.

results.title: The Blinds and the Shutters
results.brief_description: This work presents a virtual world comprised of a modernist fictional house in a remote forest setting, whose contents gradually spill and float out of every aperture. Shoes and dresses, pots and pans, cutlery, pillows, blankets and plates journey in two directions simultaneously, some disappearing into the distance never to return, others appearing across all four screens in the installation. The larger objects fade up like apparitions, disappear and then reappear in strange locations, breaking all logic that is guiding this imaginary world. The slow drift of these household objects around the four screens is uncanny. While their journey suggests that the natural phenomenon of air is present, there is also a sense of airlessness; a claustrophobic, almost heavily scented environment. Despite sharing an energy force within the virtual environment, these objects are estranged – for they have lost their domestic relationship with one another. The sounds of bumps, collisions and muffled shuffles emerging from the interior of the house underscores the mystery of this scene. The disturbing atmosphere is most bizarre when the household goods are propelled into outer space, taking on the form of miniature satellites presumably tracking our behaviour from afar.

results.title: The Dam builders
results.creator_credit: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Cine Service
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the Melbourne water supply system and the efforts of the MMBW to create enjoyable environments such as landscaping and recreation facilities in several catchment areas. Highlights the construction of the Cardinia Reservoir, near Emerald, now the largest storage area for Melbourne.

results.title: Melbourne: festival city
results.creator_credit: Gordon C. Lloyd, Tourist Development Authority of Victoria and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Melbourne’s Moomba festival - the city comes alive with processions, regattas, the Herald open air art show, music under the stars at the Myer Music Bowl, and the crowning of the Moomba Queen. The film also shows some of the Melbourne landscape and the background of daily life; Melbourne’s economic expansion; the Melbourne Cup, the race for which the nation stands still; Australian Rules Football, drawing crowds of over 50,000; fine golf courses; hunting; night life. It closes with a coverage of the Moomba procession, with all its varied floats, including the Bunyip and the Chinese dragon.

results.title: Australia's Best: Music & Images of Australians in the 80's
results.creator_credit: Pom Oliver, South Pacific Films and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A music video documentary showcasing the best of Australia’s popular music in the eighties. Features the music of Split Enz, Australian Crawl, INXS, No Fixed Address, Cold Chisel and Icehouse. Includes interviews with celebrities such as Michael Hutchence, Neil and Tim Finn, James Reyne and Grace Knight.

results.title: Australian super 8 films 1981-1986
results.brief_description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. It attempts to be a representative survey of prominent filmmakers, themes and style. A rare and important documentation of a fertile aspect of Australian film and visual arts activities. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.
